info:
Assign buttons to pages or to main.

if assigned to "main" (A/Z text)
    then it will be active on all menu pages

if assigend to msg.page 
    then it will listen to whatever is in msg.page

In this example, button 0, 1 and 2 are assigned to main
and as such always active in menu main.

The other buttons will listen to the topic with the value of msg.page in it.

name: 02 pagebutton
Initialize displayitem JSON

info:
In this block you specify the menus and
what actions press, release and longpress
will fire in each separate menu.
Be sure to open 'edit subflow template'
after dubbleclicking a menu subflow.
In these subflows, for each of the menu,
you can define a return output for each useful 
action. In the example, only 8 outputs for a single
press/click of the main menu are defined.
Feel free to change for your application.
Note that it can result in 24 outputs per menu.
(8xclick, 8xrelease, 8x longpress).
While reducing the nr of outputs to only
the actions you need might be useful, it makes it more 
difficult to maintain.
name: Open for help
Debug as placeholder. Put actions here.

info:
In this block you specify the names of the menus.
Make sure to change them in the other yellow blocks as well.
Incoming messages are parsed and distributed based on the current active menu.
In the axample 6 pages are prepared, but only 4 do exist in this application
Note that main is not used as (?? that is the default ??)
